newsitem.title: SLOVAKIA: Slovak SAX firms to 169.5 pts in listless trading.
newsitem.headline: Slovak SAX firms to 169.5 pts in listless trading.

text.p: The Slovak Bratislava Stock Exchange (BSE) edged higher on Friday, but in another dull session.
The 16-share SAX index closed up 1.95 points at 169.5, on gains to several blue chips, without much new impetus to the marekt, dealers said.
The SAX was boosted by steel maker VSZ, which closed up five at 635 crowns, on a volume of 202 shares traded, and the commercial bank VUB which gained 11 crowns to close at 1,451 on 32 traded shares.
The most heavily capitalised issue, oil refinery Slovnaft, lost 50 crowns and closed at 850 on 60 shares, preventing the index from higher increase.
Volumes remained significantly low, with brokers saying that the trend appeared still likely not to change over the summer.
Overall, volume increased to 138,781 shares, from 134,002 shares traded on Thursday, while turnover fell to 11.39 million crowns, from 40.35 million. -- Bratislava Newsroom, 421-7-521-8402
